meanings.definition: To split or divide something in advance.
meanings.sent1: I will presplit the cake before the party starts.
meanings.sent2: She always presplits the tasks to make them easier to manage.
meanings.sent3: The chef presplit the ingredients, but the cat still managed to sneak a taste.
meanings.sent4: The teacher presplit the class into groups for the project.
meanings.sent5: Presplitting the firewood saved time during the camping trip.

meanings.definition: Splitting or dividing something in advance.
meanings.sent1: The team decided to presplit the workload to finish the project on time.
meanings.sent2: Presplitting the expenses helped them budget more effectively.
meanings.sent3: He presplit the sandwich into halves, but his friend wanted a bigger share.
meanings.sent4: The farmer presplit the field for planting different crops.
meanings.sent5: Presplitting the chores made the day run smoother.
